sense.gloss: filial piety, being kind to one's parents, taking care of one's parents
devotion to one's wife, doing things for one's wife

sdata.j: ↑孝行↑↓こうこう↓したいときに↑親↑↓おや↓はなし。
sdata.e: When one would be filial, one's parents are gone.

sdata.j: ↑親孝行↑↓おやこうこう↓したいときには↑親↑↓おや↓はなし。
sdata.e: By the time you wish to be a good son, your parents are long gone.

sdata.j: ↑親孝行↑↓おやこうこう↓な↑息子↑↓むすこ↓さんがいるから、↑老後↑↓ろうご↓の↑心配↑↓しんぱい↓しなくていいわね。
sdata.e: It must be nice having such a loyal son. You don't have to wonder if you'll be taken care of in your old age.

sdata.j: ↑飯田↑↓いいだ↓↑太郎↑↓たろう↓の↑後任↑↓こうにん↓として、↑大原↑↓おおはら↓↑孝一↑↓こういち↓が↑技術↑↓ぎじゅつ↓↑部長↑↓ぶちょう↓として↑着任↑↓ちゃくにん↓したことをお↑知↑↓し↓らせいたします。
sdata.e: We are writing to inform you that Mr Koichi Ohara has been appointed as Manager of the Technical Department in succession to Mr Taro Iida.

sdata.j: ↑敬老↑↓けいろう↓の↑日↑↓ひ↓には↑祖父母↑↓そふぼ↓を↑訪↑↓たず↓ねて↑孝行↑↓こうこう↓します。
sdata.e: On the Respect-for-Senior-Citizens Day, we visit our grandparents and do nice things for them.

sdata.j: ↑昨夜↑↓ゆうべ↓、↑孝↑↓たかし↓が↑夢↑↓ゆめ↓に↑出↑↓で↓てきたよ。
sdata.e: Last night Takashi came to me in a dream.

words.gloss: filial piety, being kind to one's parents, taking care of one's parents
